# The `MemoryBufferByteStream` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

An implementation of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> whose data is backed by an llvm <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a> object. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

An implementation of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> whose data is backed by an llvm <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a> object.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybufferbytestream">MemoryBufferByteStream</a> owns the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a> in question. As with <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarybytestream">BinaryByteStream</a>, reading from a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybufferbytestream">MemoryBufferByteStream</a> will never cause a copy.

Definition at line 74 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarybytestream-h">BinaryByteStream.h</a>.
